verses.kjv: And the word of Samuel came to all Israel. Now Israel went out against the Philistines to battle, and pitched beside Ebenezer: and the Philistines pitched in Aphek.
verses.ct: Samuel's message spread throughout all of Israel. Then Israel marched out to fight the Philistines and set up camp near Ebenezer, while the Philistines set up camp at Aphek.

verses.kjv: And the Philistines put themselves in array against Israel: and when they joined battle, Israel was smitten before the Philistines: and they slew of the army in the field about four thousand men.
verses.ct: The Philistines formed their battle lines against Israel. As the fighting intensified, Israel was defeated by the Philistines, who killed about 4,000 soldiers on the battlefield.

verses.kjv: And when the people were come into the camp, the elders of Israel said, Wherefore hath the LORD smitten us to day before the Philistines? Let us fetch the ark of the covenant of the LORD out of Shiloh unto us, that, when it cometh among us, it may save us out of the hand of our enemies.
verses.ct: When the troops returned to camp, the elders of Israel asked, "Why did the LORD let the Philistines defeat us today? Let's bring the ark of the covenant of the LORD from Shiloh. When it arrives among us, it will rescue us from our enemies."

verses.kjv: So the people sent to Shiloh, that they might bring from thence the ark of the covenant of the LORD of hosts, which dwelleth between the cherubims: and the two sons of Eli, Hophni and Phinehas, were there with the ark of the covenant of God.
verses.ct: So the people sent messengers to Shiloh, and they brought back the ark of the covenant of the LORD of hosts, who is enthroned between the cherubim. Eli's 2 sons, Hophni and Phinehas, were there accompanying the ark of the covenant of God.

verses.kjv: And when the ark of the covenant of the LORD came into the camp, all Israel shouted with a great shout, so that the earth rang again.
verses.ct: When the ark of the covenant of the LORD arrived in the camp, all of Israel erupted in such a tremendous shout that the ground shook.

verses.kjv: And when the Philistines heard the noise of the shout, they said, What meaneth the noise of this great shout in the camp of the Hebrews? And they understood that the ark of the LORD was come into the camp.
verses.ct: When the Philistines heard the roar of the shouting, they asked, "What is all this loud cheering in the Hebrew camp?" Then they learned that the ark of the LORD had arrived in the camp.

verses.kjv: And the Philistines were afraid, for they said, God is come into the camp. And they said, Woe unto us! for there hath not been such a thing heretofore.
verses.ct: The Philistines were terrified. "A god has come into their camp!" they said. "This is terrible for us! Nothing like this has ever happened before."

verses.kjv: Woe unto us! who shall deliver us out of the hand of these mighty Gods? these are the Gods that smote the Egyptians with all the plagues in the wilderness.
verses.ct: "This is terrible! Who can save us from these powerful gods? These are the same gods who struck the Egyptians with every kind of plague in the wilderness."

verses.kjv: Be strong, and quit yourselves like men, O ye Philistines, that ye be not servants unto the Hebrews, as they have been to you: quit yourselves like men, and fight.
verses.ct: "Stand firm and act like warriors, Philistines! Otherwise you'll become slaves to the Hebrews, just as they have been to you. Fight like warriors!"

verses.kjv: And the Philistines fought, and Israel was smitten, and they fled every man into his tent: and there was a very great slaughter; for there fell of Israel thirty thousand footmen.
verses.ct: So the Philistines fought, and Israel was defeated. Every man fled to his own home. The slaughter was devastating — 30,000 Israelite foot soldiers fell that day.

verses.kjv: And the ark of God was taken; and the two sons of Eli, Hophni and Phinehas, were slain.
verses.ct: The ark of God was captured, and Eli's 2 sons, Hophni and Phinehas, were killed.

verses.kjv: And there ran a man of Benjamin out of the army, and came to Shiloh the same day with his clothes rent, and with earth upon his head.
verses.ct: A man from the tribe of Benjamin ran from the battlefield and reached Shiloh that same day. His clothes were torn and dirt was on his head.

verses.kjv: And when he came, lo, Eli sat upon a seat by the wayside watching: for his heart trembled for the ark of God. And when the man came into the city, and told it, all the city cried out.
verses.ct: When he arrived, Eli was sitting on a chair beside the road, watching anxiously, because his heart was full of dread about the ark of God. When the man entered the town and reported the news, the entire town burst into wailing.

verses.kjv: And when Eli heard the noise of the crying, he said, What meaneth the noise of this tumult? And the man came in hastily, and told Eli.
verses.ct: When Eli heard the sound of the outcry, he asked, "What is all this commotion about?" The man hurried over and told Eli everything.

verses.kjv: Now Eli was ninety and eight years old; and his eyes were dim, that he could not see.
verses.ct: Eli was 98 years old, and his eyes had become so weak that he could no longer see.

verses.kjv: And the man said unto Eli, I am he that came out of the army, and I fled to day out of the army. And he said, What is there done, my son?
verses.ct: The man said to Eli, "I just came from the battlefield — I escaped from the fighting today." Eli asked, "What happened, my son?"

verses.kjv: And the messenger answered and said, Israel is fled before the Philistines, and there hath been also a great slaughter among the people, and thy two sons also, Hophni and Phinehas, are dead, and the ark of God is taken.
verses.ct: The messenger replied, "Israel has fled from the Philistines. There has been a massive slaughter among the troops. Your 2 sons, Hophni and Phinehas, are dead, and the ark of God has been captured."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when he made mention of the ark of God, that he fell from off the seat backward by the side of the gate, and his neck brake, and he died: for he was an old man, and heavy. And he had judged Israel forty years.
verses.ct: The moment he mentioned the ark of God, Eli fell backward off his chair beside the gate. His neck broke and he died, because he was old and heavy. He had led Israel as judge for 40 years.

verses.kjv: And his daughter in law, Phinehas’ wife, was with child, near to be delivered: and when she heard the tidings that the ark of God was taken, and that her father in law and her husband were dead, she bowed herself and travailed; for her pains came upon her.
verses.ct: His daughter-in-law, the wife of Phinehas, was pregnant and close to her due date. When she heard the news that the ark of God had been captured and that her father-in-law and her husband were dead, she collapsed and went into labor, because the contractions overwhelmed her.

verses.kjv: And about the time of her death the women that stood by her said unto her, Fear not; for thou hast born a son. But she answered not, neither did she regard it.
verses.ct: As she was dying, the women attending her said, "Don't be afraid — you've given birth to a son!" But she didn't respond or pay any attention.

verses.kjv: And she named the child Ichabod, saying, The glory is departed from Israel: because the ark of God was taken, and because of her father in law and her husband.
verses.ct: She named the boy Ichabod, saying, "The glory has left Israel" — because the ark of God had been captured, and because of the deaths of her father-in-law and her husband.

verses.kjv: And she said, The glory is departed from Israel: for the ark of God is taken.
verses.ct: She said, "The glory has left Israel, for the ark of God has been captured."
